perturbation.original_text: This Consulting Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this 2nd day of January 2020, by and between Global Technologies, Ltd (hereinafter the "Company"), a Delaware corporation whose address is 501 1st Ave N., Suite 901, St. Petersburg, FL 33701 and Timothy Cabrera (hereinafter the "Consultant"), an individual whose address is 11718 SE Federal Hwy., Suite 372, Hobe Sound, FL 33455 (individually, a "Party"; collectively, the "Parties"). This Agreement is non-exclusive.
perturbation.changed_text: This Consulting Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this 2nd day of January 2020, by and between Global Technologies, Ltd (hereinafter the "Company"), a Delaware corporation whose address is 501 1st Ave N., Suite 901, St. Petersburg, FL 33701 and Timothy Cabrera (hereinafter the "Service Provider"), an individual whose address is 11718 SE Federal Hwy., Suite 372, Hobe Sound, FL 33455 (individually, a "Party"; collectively, the "Parties"). This Agreement is non-exclusive.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Consultant' is replaced with 'Service Provider'. The entire document references 'Consultant', creating ambiguity and confusion regarding whether the terms are interchangeable or refer to different roles. This contradiction leads to uncertainty in enforcement, especially in sections that define responsibilities and compensation.

perturbation.original_text: 5. COMPENSATION TO CONSULTANT. As Consultant's entire compensation for its performance under this agreement, the Company shall pay Consultant $250,000,00 cash compensation. In addition, the Consultant shall earn additional cash compensation for the sale of any inventory/assets that were acquired in the acquisition of TCBM Holdings, LLC on November 30, 2019. Any cash compensation paid to Consultant shall be treated as a reduction in principal to the Convertible Note ("Note") issued by the Company to Jetco Holdings, LLC ("Jetco") on November 30, 2019. For example: The $250,000 cash compensation paid to Consultant shall reduce the Jetco Note principal amount by $250,000.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. COMPENSATION TO SERVICE PROVIDER. As Contractor's entire compensation for its performance under this agreement, the Company shall pay the Consultant $250,000,00 cash compensation. In addition, the Service Provider shall earn additional cash compensation for the sale of any inventory/assets that were acquired in the acquisition of TCBM Holdings, LLC on November 30, 2019. Any cash compensation paid to the Consultant shall be treated as a reduction in principal to the Convertible Note ("Note") issued by the Company to Jetco Holdings, LLC ("Jetco") on November 30, 2019. For example: The $250,000 cash compensation paid to Consultant shall reduce the Jetco Note principal amount by $250,000.
perturbation.explanation: Multiple terms are introduced without proper definition ('Service Provider', 'Consultant', 'Contractor'), while others are used interchangeably within the same section. The section starts talking about COMPENSATION TO SERVICE PROVIDER but then goes on to say the cash will be paid to the Consultant. It is unclear whether these roles refer to distinct or overlapping entities. This creates a conflict regarding which entity is entitled to the compensation and affects the enforceability of payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: 11. Non-Circumvention. In and for valuable consideration, the Company hereby agrees that Consultant may introduce (whether by written, oral, data, or other form of communication) the Company to one or more opportunities, including, without limitation, existing or potential investors, lenders, borrowers, trusts, natural persons, corporations, limited liability companies, partnerships, unincorporated businesses, sole proprietorships and similar entities (an "Opportunity" or "Opportunities"). The Company further acknowledges and agrees that the identity of the subject Opportunities, and all other information concerning an Opportunity (including without limitation, all mailing information, phone and fax numbers, email addresses and other contact information) introduced hereunder are the property of Consultant, and shall be treated as confidential information by the Company, it affiliates, officers, directors, shareholders, employees, agents, representatives, successors and assigns.
perturbation.changed_text: 11. Non-Circumvention. In and for valuable consideration, the Company hereby agrees that Representative may introduce (whether by written, oral, data, or other form of communication) the Company to one or more opportunities, including, without limitation, existing or potential investors, lenders, borrowers, trusts, natural persons, corporations, limited liability companies, partnerships, unincorporated businesses, sole proprietorships and similar entities (an "Opportunity" or "Opportunities"). The Company further acknowledges and agrees that the identity of the subject Opportunities, and all other information concerning an Opportunity (including without limitation, all mailing information, phone and fax numbers, email addresses and other contact information) introduced hereunder are the property of Consultant, and shall be treated as confidential information by the Company, it affiliates, officers, directors, shareholders, employees, agents, representatives, successors and assigns.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Consultant' is replaced by 'Representative' within the same section, while the second half uses Consultant. It is not clear whether the definitions are referring to the same entity. This introduces ambiguity in the terms, especially in non-circumvention and confidentiality clauses, and may complicate enforcement of these clauses if it's disputed who the 'Representative' or 'Consultant' actually is.
